news.title: Man appears in court charged with murder of dad of two and attempted murder of priest on same day
news.summary: A man has appeared in court charged with the murder of Stephen Brannigan and the attempted murder of a priest.

news.title: Seán Gallagher resigned from role at presidential hopeful Gareth Sheridan’s firm in row over $180,000 corporate box
news.summary: The former presidential candidate Seán Gallagher resigned as a director of Gareth Sheridan’s company in a row over a $180,000-a-year (€154,000) ­corporate box.

news.title: Benjamin Netanyahu reportedly in talks with South Sudan to take Gazans as Israeli bombs kill 123 in past day
news.summary: Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu is reportedly in talks with South Sudan about ‘allowing’ Palestinians from Gaza to move there amid the ongoing Israeli offensive on the besieged Strip.

news.title: Irishman dies in Ecuador prison after being held over six-figure cocaine bust
news.summary: An Irishman has died in Ecuador, where he was being held in prison following a €600,000 cocaine smuggling bust.

news.title: Strike threats and loitering in car parks – how footballers push to leave clubs for pastures new – but is it effective?
news.summary: How powerful is player power really? The Jean-Marc Bosman butterfly effect has led to Alexander Isak pushing to leave Newcastle and being left out of the side because he is not in the right frame of mind as he attempts to force through a move to Liverpool.

news.title: Airport security worker demoted for kissing colleague should get job back, WRC rules
news.summary: Airport chiefs have been urged to give a security worker his old job back as a supervisor after he was demoted for kissing a subordinate while they were at work together at a screening line two summers ago.

news.title: Pól Ó Conghaile: The agony and ecstasy of red-eye flights
news.summary: They are the best of times. They are the worst of times. They can be magical, or utterly miserable. They are red-eye flights, and they are at once an incredible privilege and a perfect torture.

news.title: How a log chalet home led to a 10-year planning row between three siblings
news.summary: A 73-year-old woman who was granted retention for her log chalet home is locked in a planning dispute after her two brothers objected to the decision.

news.title: Saoirse Hanley: As a practically translucent woman, I understand wanting sun-kissed skin, but we have  to stop pretending using sunbeds is normal
news.summary: I am by no means the authority on what is and isn't healthy. I drink an arguably normal amount but still consume alcohol regularly. Though I would never classify myself as a smoker, a single menthol cigarette has been known to pass my lips once in a drunken blue moon.

news.title: Claim over ‘off the rails’ probe into Coolock industrial blaze ‘resolved’ at tribunal
news.summary: A company accused of sacking a worker based on an “off the rails” investigation into a major industrial fire which razed its premises on Dublin’s northside last summer has agreed to resolve his workplace rights case without proceeding to a full hearing.
